comment: I had Dr. P for Juvenile Justice and got a C, &was debating whether or not to take her again for Senior Sem.; I needed the class so I risked it & took it. her material is heavy, & there is a lot of reading, textbook is required for the discussion & tests. online was similar to in person. with hard work i was able to get an A. paper is 22% of grade
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Petersen was one of the most down to earth professors I have ever had. She is a strict grader, but will make sure you make it in her class if you truly try your hardest. She is so incredibly sweet and really cares about her job! I have the utmost respect for her.

Dr. Petersen is a fantastic professor and she does an amazing job at making her class very interesting, I don't find myself zoning out. She gives lots of opportunities to participate in class. Her exams are hard, I didn't do well in this class due to that. Study a lot and don't take her if you skip a lot or don't have time or care to put in effort.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: One of the easiest classes I've ever taken. I went to 1/3 of the classes and got an A. Shes an easy grader and seems to enjoy her work which makes class bearable. Theres a group project that seems like a lot of work but I did my part the day before and got a 94. Its an easy A, just make sure you do the work she assigns (which is not a lot).
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Senior Seminar with Dr. Petersen was one of the hardest classes of my undergrad, but it was such a great learning experience. She pushed our class to submit our very best work and to always strive for perfection. She is extremely knowledgeable about the criminal justice field, and has extensive experience in this discipline. I highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She makes her expectations very clear and grades STRICTLY. Assignments are straightforward weekly discussions, quizzes, lecture videos, a HUGE paper, and two timed essay exams (questions sent out a week before). She is very knowledgeable on CJ topics so she is a very useful resource and is willing to help and work with you.
Had all the exams on lockdown browser but required use of the textbook/ lectures for the essays.  How am I supposed to access the textbook if it's in lockdown???
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: 4 week class. This is easily the worst and most unnecessarily difficult class I've taken at KSU. This is one of those classes where the professor assumes you have no life, other classes or obligations. And I'm gonna keep it real real here. If you dont either study your ass off or use quizlet to help with the quizzes, you will run out of time 100%.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Research Methods with Dr. Petersen was one of the toughest classes I've taken yet, but it was very rewarding. Dr. Petersen doesn't make her class unnecessarily hard, and tries her best to guide the students through the material. This class was no cake walk, but Dr. Petersen is a very intelligent professor and is well informed on the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Took her for an online summer class. You will have to complete a whole semester of discussions, responses and quizzes in four weeks. She grades assignments and leaves no feedback unless u get a 100- and she rarely did that. WOULD NOT TAKE AGAIN... NOT AN EASY CLASS!

loved her as a person, she was harsh as a professor. There was always so much due. Never a week where the material alone was enough. She grades really harshly, but she was kind and funny. The research proposal paper was so stressful though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: By far one of the worse courses I have taken at Kennesaw. Every week a giant discussion post is due "two separate posts on two different topics" which equal a small paper. Weekly quizzes are just essentially very short and hard weekly exams which take an hour 15 mins of time most people run out of time. Trust me you'll regret taking her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: currently in the corrections online course and it is the worst thing i think ive ever done. she has "quizzes" due every week. they are not quizzes. they are EXAMS. 34 questions with 4 essay questions and i mean ESSAY questions. Shes so rude when you email her and rude in her posts. such a tough grader and i would just not recommend to anyone

I was sad to see some of the reviews she has... I thought this prof was really cool! She gets sidetracked A LOT but it's usually funny. Her study guides are just like the tests and I think the most difficult part was the research paper but if you don't procrastinate and ask her questions throughout, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Makes the most difficult class in the criminal justice major relatively easy. The best instructor. She is passionate about her teaching and she loves her students. Always willing to help students. She is a gem .

Dr. Peterson is very educated and smart but she refuses to simplify anything. She doesnt teach and what she does explain, you most likely wont understand a word. She constantly reminds us how hard the class is but simultaneously sidetracks herself. Be ready to teach yourself everything. BEWARE: her study guides have nothing to do with the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: FANTASTIC! THE BEST TEACHER AT KSU!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: She doesn't know what she's talking about most of the time. Always late for class and always takes forever to answer emails making it too late to submit projects. She thinks shes always right about everything until you prove her wrong to her face. I highly do not recommend you don't take this class.

Do not take for Research Methods. You have to write a research proposal paper and she will shoot down your topic over and over with no feedback. She takes over a week to respond to emails and drop box submissions so by the time she responds everything is late.

First of all she can never remember my name. She makes you right a research proposal that you must get approved before you can write your paper. However, she will turn your topic down with no reason why and tell you to try again. Probably the worst teacher I have ever had.
Unclear schedule for class, routinely cancels class 5 minutes before the starting time, pop quizzes, and the list goes on. Go with another teacher.

Great professor! One of the few professors that can actually make Research Methods bearable and even somewhat enjoyable. Makes herself readily available when additional help is needed on various assignments. Requires a good bit of effort if you desire to make a good grade due to the somewhat complexity of the subject matter. Good sense of humor!

I took this class over the summer and it was very simple. You need to read the chapters to do the quizzes and the only thing difficult for me was the 5 minute discussions. You have 5 minutes to answer a question based on the materials. It isn't difficult, but if you are someone like me  who isn't good at answering off the top of your head, it is.

She is funny. Take notes and pay attention. You have to go to class because lecture note are huge on the test. You NEED the textbook for this class. You use it all the time. She really is a good professor and she makes things easy to understand. Assignments are very easy.

Insanely interesting and keeps your attention the entire class. I genuinely enjoyed the content. Must attend a court proceeding but it teaches you a lot. Tests are not cumulative but are fairly tough. Lots of court cases to know. Would take this class again.
She was very helpful. You need the book. Weekly discussions are a must, weekly quizzes need to be done. She was very clear about what needed to be done.

Okay. She is a good, average intro teacher. She is really dedicated and passionate about her field. That being said, she is a little scattered and REALLY relies on the book. She also tends to focus on small specifics rather than overall concepts. A little disappointed yet overall satisfied.
Great teacher!  Read the book...you will need to in order to do well in the class.  Discussions are great and she respects everyone's views/opinions
I felt she was a very good and articulate teacher, she gave you what you needed to learn and didn't throw any curve balls... she is an amazing teacher and a must to take!

Awesome professor! She makes the class fun and interesting. If you go to class, take notes, and study mycrimekit, the tests are easy. You have to attend a criminal trial and write a 3 page paper, but it's easy. I took her class as an elective because I needed more hours, but I would definitely recommend her even if you're not a CJ major.

She is a great teacher. She gives great notes during class based from the book. You can have one 10 point extra credit which is really easy. Make sure to go to class to get quiz points. Study everything on study guide for test. use mycrimekit. she has a great personality and makes the class really interesting.

A really cool teacher who knows her stuff and enjoys teaching. Three tests overall and small assignments and pop quizzes thoughout each section so read the book before class. Required to attend a criminal trial and attendence is mandatory, but overall a pretty interesting and easy class!!

Good professor, boring class. It's a hybrid class with weekly discussions. Follow her instructions and you'll do fine. Oh, and students really need to learn how to write an essay for this class -- this is college...not high school.

You have to read the book before every class. If not, then class and the quizzes/tests will be like running through Mordor naked. Interesting class, though I would not take her again bc i didnt like the way she taught. And she's going through a hard core mid-life crisis right now. Just a warning

She's amazing. Shes funny and interesting. The material is very interesting so the reading isn't bad. She gives easy pop quizzes. I love her and am considering changing my major to CJ because I love her!!

I made a B because I did not prepare enough for the first test. She is a great teacher and I would recommend her to anyone. She is so funny and very nice. The course is not hard. It is actually very interesting. Just keep up with your readings and prepare enough for the test. She tells you what is on the test! SHE great!

She is the best. She has a great since of humor and she is not hard. She is very knowledgeable and loves teaching this course. Just keep up with your readings and she will let you know what is on the test. Test is multiple choice, short answer, but if you prepare you will do fine. RECOMMEND HER!!

I didn't like her at first but she is very real and funny. She is a nice lady but her tests are not easy and she can be a little unclear of what to study for. I did get an A in the class but I had to work hard for it. If you want a good grade just make sure you study hard for the tests. She does make the class enjoyable and her ways are funny.

She is a fun professor. Class is always very interesting, although she sometimes gets off the topic at hand. Get the online MyCrimeKit, it was very helpful for the two tests given in this class. I would highly recommend taking Dr. Petersen!
SHES GREAT I LOVED HER SHE SEEMS AT FIRST LIKE SHES GOING TO BE A B BUT SHE ROWS ON U REAL QUICK THINKING BOUT CHANGING MY MAJOR TO CJ

I started off not loving this class but Petersen grew on me. She is a little out there and weird but she is nice and is very helpful. The quizzes can be hard because they are specific but tests aren't too bad if you study. MC, true/false, with a few short answer. Papers are short and easy. Good class.. but she takes some getting use to!
She's by far one of my favorite professors! :P
She is awesome, by far one of my favorite teachers of all time! plus she is smokin Hot!!!!

She's a very funny and reasonable teacher. She relates the material well. The pop quizes are basically impossible. The mock sentencing was the best part of class. Tests and assignments are relatively easy. Showing up for class is a must. The courtroom paper is somewhat challenging. She grades very slowly, I ended up making a B,due to the pop quizes

Your grade consists of 20% Exam 1, 20% Exam 2, 20% FInal, 20% research propsal, and 20 HW & Quizes. Very hard and boring class not matter who you take she tries her best to get you through it. Study hard is what you need to do and don't miss class or you will be lost. You should try to convince her to use a index card on the exams "type small".

A lot of information is covered. The book is a must have! Many of the test questions come right from the study guide but do not purchase it. The study guide is available online free of charge. Overall, good teacher but you do have to study to pass the class.

Tech & CJ. 3 issue papers(12%),Presentation(15%), Mterm(17%),Final(17%), quizzes(17%),web discussions(10%),Attendance/participation(12%).Tough grader but u learn a great deal of info, easy grading on presentation though.allowed 3'5 card for exams(hint learn to read in 4 font).essay exams,u know the questions ahead of time.Lot of reading but no book
Very good teacher!! I took a summer course that was a little over two hours long. She kept my attention the entire time. I felt that I learned a lot from this class.
Not very helpfull at all.

Great class! Interesting and varied. Read the chapters before class, because she likes you to be prepared for discussion. Do the study guide before tests; it helps. She gives an extra credit assignment and is willing to help you. Cares about her subject and her students.
Very  nice teacher, interesting class. Tests can be hard if you don't study. But if you study all of your notes and do the study guide, you should get an A.

Very good teacher, makes class very interesting. Tests can be hard, a lot of material. Fun field trip. Takes attendence, something that should not happen in college. Would recommend. Has passion for her field.

I took a June class w/ her this summer, and it flew by. you have to attend class and read, because she's very into quizzes and you never know when she'll give one, but its quite frequently.  i thought i was going to get a b in the class, and was shocked when i got an A. overall, a very interesting class, and she's very intelligent and interesting. i highly reccomend her.

This teacher was nice but hard.  She was kind of anal with quizzes.  She really wanted to make sure you were doing the readings.  But, you can be very frank in the class discussions. You feel like your talking to somebody young, not some old geezer.

She is worth taking...wont get your hopes down, TRUST ME!  Thought she comes off distant or moody she is actually not!  ALot of various types of activites to do in the class and not boring AT ALL!  I always look forward to her classes!  Do the work and study and you will be golden!

This professor has her ups and downs. I wish she would explain a little more on what she wants and also have more confidence in what she is talking about. Overall not a bad professor, but not the best.
This teacher is very devoted to what she teaches.  She constantly applies what she teaches to real life.  I definitely recommend her as a professor.
This woman knows exactly what she's talking about. She explains everything very clear and is always willing to help. I definitely highly reccommend this professor.
